summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from a correctional officer detailing the response and procedures following Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It documents the timeline from when his remains were at New York Presbyterian Hospital through their transport to the city morgue.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose remains are being handled; identified as 76318-054. The document details the post-death procedures for his body.

persons.name: Wiggins
persons.role: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME)
persons.context: The Director of the Office of the City Medical Examiner (OCME) with whom the Institution Duty Officer coordinates the transport of Epstein's remains from the hospital to the city morgue.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Operations Lieutenant who requested the emergency hospital detail that the responding officer was assigned to.

connections.description: Wiggins, as Director of the OCME, is the official responsible for receiving and transporting Epstein's remains to the city morgue as part of the death investigation procedure.

events.title: Epstein's Death and Initial Body Handling
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found deceased at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. His remains are taken to New York Presbyterian Hospital and later transported to the city morgue by the Office of the City Medical Examiner.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a formal memorandum dated August 10, 2019, detailing the immediate institutional response to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Epstein's remains were initially at New York Presbyterian Hospital (room A9 in the emergency room) before being moved to the hospital morgue.
The Office of the City Medical Examiner (OCME), under Director Wiggins, took custody of the remains and transported them to the city morgue.
The timeline shows coordinated communication and procedures between correctional staff (IDO, A/W) and the medical examiner's office starting around 11:35 AM.
The remains were transported from the hospital to the city morgue at approximately 12:57 PM on August 10, 2019.
